verses.verse: Sons, hear the instruction of a father, pay attention to know understanding.
For I give you good teaching, do not forsake my Law.
For I was my father's son, tender and an only one in the sight of my mother.
And he taught me and said to me, May my words hold to your heart; keep my commands and live.
Obtain wisdom, and with all your obtaining, obtain understanding; do not stretch out, and do not stretch away from the words of my mouth.
Do not forsake her, and she will preserve you; love her, and she will keep you.
The first thing is wisdom; obtain wisdom, and with all your obtaining, obtain understanding.
Exalt her, and she will lift you up; she shall bring you to honor when you embrace her.
She shall give a wreath of grace to your head; she shall shield you with a crown of glory.
Oh my son, hear and receive my sayings, and the years of your life shall be many.
I have taught you in the way of wisdom; I have made you walk in the right tracks;
when you go, your tracks shall not be narrowed, and if you run, you shall not stumble.
Take fast hold of instruction, do not let go; keep her, for she is your life.
Do not enter into the path of the wicked ones, and do not go straight in the way of evil ones
Avoid it, do not pass by it; turn from it and pass on.
For they do not sleep if they have done no evil, and their sleep is taken away if not they cause some to stumble.
For they eat the bread of wickedness, and drink the wine of violence.
But the path of the righteous ones is as a light of brightness going on and shining till the day is established.
The way of the wicked ones is as darkness; they do not know at what they stumble.
My son, pay attention to my words; stretch your ear to what I say;
let them not depart from your eyes; keep them in the center of your heart;
for they are life to those who find them, and healing to all his flesh.
Keep your heart with all diligence, for out of it are the issues of life.
Turn away from you the crooked mouth, and put devious lips far from you.
Let your eyes look straight to the front, and let your eyelids look straight before you.
Ponder the track of your feet, then all your ways will be established.
Do not stretch to the right or to the left; turn your foot aside from evil.
